input_args.text1: [' “春运”是我国所具有的独特现象。除1.5亿农村劳动力涌入城市之外，还有数亿中国人离开“家”（父母及其他亲人所在地）在异地工作、生活，春节“回家”的洪流不可阻挡，哪怕远隔千山万水都要关山飞渡。“回家”成为传统中国人古老而温馨的遗风。2004年全国“春运”人数达到了19亿人次，2005年接近19.5亿人次，2006年更是突破了惊人的20亿大关。其中，2003年“春运”铁路输送旅客1.347亿人次（公路达16.67亿人次、民航为900万人次），2004年为1.37亿人次，2005年为1.4亿人次，2006年为1.49亿人次，2007年为1.59亿人次，2010年达2.1亿人次，2011年达到空前的2.3亿人次，2012年为2.2亿人次。这大大超过了我国铁路客运的承受能力，使我国铁路不堪重负，客运列车严重超员，旅客频现精神病，行凶和自杀事件频发。每年春运期间，均发生旅客跳车自杀事件。在拥挤不堪的列车内长途乘车，长时间无睡眠，极度疲劳，加之严重超员、空气混浊，部分原有精神病史或遇到过挫折、精神负担重，以及带有大量现金的旅客，精神压力过大，极易诱发突发性精神病。在北京西客站，曾发生多起长途旅行后精神恍惚的旅客高坠自杀的事件。每年“春运”期间，列车突发性精神病现象频繁出现，有的民工专列甚至发生多起伤人、自杀案件。据广州铁路公安处乘警大队统计，在列车上自杀的乘客近年来有上升趋势，从广州站开出的列车2001年“春运”期间有10人自杀，2002年“春运”期间有12人自杀。从历年的情况来看，发生突发精神病最多的是沿海开往西线的列车，患者95%以上是农民工。这些列车民工流量过大，超员严重，运行时间长，车厢拥挤、空气不畅，乘车人员容易产生焦躁情绪和幻觉，发生突发性精神病。']
input_args.text2: ['Suicides in China occur largely in the daytime and early evenings and rarely at night. According to two sets of data from He Zhaoxiong (1980-1990), suicides occur primarily in the daytime (0600 hrs to 1900 hrs). The first set of data shows that daytime suicides make up 72% of the total, while the second set of data reveals a proportion of 62%. This makes for a marked difference from overseas data, which show suicides to occur mostly after nightfall. Li Wenshi,  et al ., report that the number of suicides was the highest between 0600 hrs and 2100 hrs, which add up to 86.6% of the total. [130] Gao Wei,  et al ., found in their examination of 878 cases of suicide among youths aged between 13 and 19 that 21.18% or 186 of these suicides occurred in the early morning or morning, with the peak time at 1015 hrs; 692 or 78.82% of the suicides occurred in the afternoons or the evening with the peak time at 1930 hrs. Hu Yan,  et al ., found after an examination of 1,756 cases of suicide that 80% of suicides by poisoning occurred in the afternoon with the peak period between 1730 hrs and 2130 hrs.[132] This time of day is when people come home to spend time with family or to be alone after a long day of work or school. Interaction with family members increases the likelihood of conflicts, a leading cause of suicide. When individuals are alone, they are prone to anxiety and fear, and can easily feel helpless and even world-weary. There is no one around to help allay their low spirits and distress, thus the possibility of suicide increases. Furthermore, the pesticides used for suicide in rural areas and the medications used for suicide in urban areas in China are generally stored at home and are thus easily accessible.']
